newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigerian stocks firm but dealers still gloomy.
newsitem.headline: Nigerian stocks firm but dealers still gloomy.

text.p: A rise in Union Bank shares gave the Nigerian bourse index a lift on Friday but dealers said they expected many share prices to continue falling into next week.
The stock exchange said the all-share index rose to 7975.21 on Friday from 7972.63 on Thursday.
"The market is yet to hit the bottom," one dealer said. "New money in bank vaults is not coming into shares yet."
There were relatively few price movements on Friday.
Union Bank jumped 45 kobo to 9.80 naira on speculation. Afribank gained five kobo to close at 4.05 naira.
Cadbury was the biggest decliner, down 1.50 naira at 28.50 naira. West African Portland Cement Company dropped 20 kobo to 58.50 naira and African Petroleum slid 10 kobo to 46.80 naira.
Cornerstone Insurance ended at 2.70 naira, up five kobo.
Conglomerate CFAO was up 10 kobo to 3.30 naira.
